data.text: Alleluia, a Psalm of Agg√¶us and Zacharias.147. 1 In the original text, the following verses are numbered 12 to 20.
For he has strengthened the bars of thy gates; he has blessed thy children within thee.
He makes thy borders peaceful, and fills thee with the 147. 3 Lit. fat of wheat.flour of wheat.
He sends his oracle to the earth: his word will run swiftly.
He gives snow like wool: he scatters the mist like ashes.
Casting forth his ice like morsels: who shall stand before his cold?
He shall send out his word, and melt them: he shall blow with his wind, and the waters shall flow.
He sends his word to Jacob, his ordinances and judgments to Israel.
He has not done so to 147. 9 Gr. every.any other nation; and he has not shewn them his judgments.
